thread.title: Kudajeski was committed to area high school sports
thread.title_full: Kudajeski was committed to area high school sports

author: STAFF REPORT
title: Kudajeski was committed to area high school sports
text:
Kudajeski was committed to area high school sports STAFF REPORT Sign Up Text Alerts | newsletter 
The West Scranton sports community suffered a loss Friday with the passing of Jerry Kudajeski, a former coach of the boys basketball and baseball teams. 
“I would simply say that Jerry was a guy who was committed to his teaching in the industrial arts program and worked hard with the basketball program and was very committed to his baseball team,” said former West Scranton athletic director Tom Smith, who was the girls basketball coach when Kudajeski coached the boys. “He was very committed to his kids. He loved the sports, he liked the kids and he was always good to be around.” 
Kudajeski, who was born in 1934, was also a teacher at the school and served as a PIAA official for baseball, football and basketball. 
Kudajeski’s contributions to coaching and officiating earned him many accolades over the years, including an induction into the Chic Feldman Scranton Area Sports Hall of Fame.
